intro: Micropetalon lanceolatum, commonly known as the lanceleaf micropetalon, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in the spring. Its botanical features include a woody stem and opposite leaf arrangement, which are typical of many species in its family. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
